hints.content:
##Rhombus

A rhombus is a quadrilateral with $4$ equal side lengths.

[[☃ explanation 2]]

options.explanation:
![3 shapes with 4 equal sides. One shape also has 4 right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ed7962e9a34dddb74aecc04ddf4d6e32451a3988)

Yes, a square is also a rhombus, because all $4$ sides of a square have the same length.

hints.content: Which of the shapes is a quadrilateral with $4$ equal side lengths?

The following shapes are rhombuses:  

 | | 
- | - | -
![A shape with 4 equal sides and 2 pair of parallel sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1cfbb28b5bb29bb693674d0424380be77a4778cb) |![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/19dea1ced21d6b12a130a6b054f6b478b8714948)

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
Yes, it is!  

A rhombus is a quadrilateral with all sides of equal length.

Squares are quadrilaterals. Squares have all sides of equal length.

So, squares are rhombuses!
options.showPrompt: Isn't the right one a square?

question.content:
**Which of the following shapes are rhombuses?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A shape with 4 equal sides and 2 pair of parallel sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1cfbb28b5bb29bb693674d0424380be77a4778cb)
![A shape with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/19dea1ced21d6b12a130a6b054f6b478b8714948)
![A shape with 4 sides and 2 pair of parallel sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d679887c888c298f8e3f3d94edc87ad3c18c5baf)
